column4: It just keeps saying I need Qt >= Qt 2.2.2(headers and libraries).
But I downloaded all the Qt I could see.
did you try the package i suggested before?
I've been downloading so many packages. Which one was that?
qt3-apps-dev
I already downloaded and installed that one.
1 sec
I just downloaded all the packages I could find with qt and -dev in them. So I got that one for sure.
wait are you on KDE?
No I don't believe so. I think it's still gnome running compiz.
you MIGHT want to try a ,/configure --with-qt-includes="path to your qt includes"
I don't know where qt includes is.
you make a valid point, honestly i'm not even sure where they would be, but if you can find them that just might work :D
I ran a search. 'No files found.'
You know what I just want a CD mount program. Is there another that's easier to install?
like for virtual cd drives?
Yes. Like Alcohol 120(win) and Daemon Tools(win).
i THINK arson does that? you might want to try nikrud's suggestion for the qt location
Not really, this isn't the place to discuss it but nano is much different in many ways.
Isn't there a command you can run in terminal to backup your grub.list?
sure there is, but that wouldn't really help if you can't boot to restore it :P
